title: minerjones
author: minerjones
content: 2013 Alitin Mint Adam Smith 2btc silver 2oz #154 / 600*Coin was never loaded, so is not one of the ones that got swept by the maker*Do not recommend loading this coinSTARTING BID: 0.0000BTCMINIMUM BID INCREMENT: 0.0005BTC**Please limit bids to ONLY 4 decimal places**END TIME: DECEMBER 8th, 2022, 15:00:00 PST**Payment due within 24 hours of auction end!!**SNIPE: Any bid made in last 5 minutes will extend the auction 5 minutes beyond the ending time.If within those 5 extended minutes, a new bid is made, 5 minutes will be added to the auction from the time of that bid.PAYMENT: Bitcoin BTC. A signed PGP message will be sent to winner with payment addressSHIPPING: Based on location and preference

comments.author: pinky1234
comments.body: Its ashamed maker scam many collectors. funny to say the many beautiful coins design from 2013-18 end up been a scam ..  Nice coin

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: No holo on back? Where are private keys stored on these... besides with the coinmaker

comments.author: krogoth
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptogreatdane on December 03, 2022, 08:27:10 PMNo holo on back? Where are private keys stored on these... besides with the coinmaker I believe you would need to crack the case open for the private keys

comments.author: stackinsats777
comments.body: Quote from: krogoth on December 03, 2022, 08:36:38 PMQuote from: Cryptogreatdane on December 03, 2022, 08:27:10 PMNo holo on back? Where are private keys stored on these... besides with the coinmaker I believe you would need to crack the case open for the private keysYep pretty sure it’s engraved/etched on the side of the coin

comments.author: krogoth
comments.body: Quote from: stackinsats777 on December 03, 2022, 08:46:26 PMQuote from: krogoth on December 03, 2022, 08:36:38 PMQuote from: Cryptogreatdane on December 03, 2022, 08:27:10 PMNo holo on back? Where are private keys stored on these... besides with the coinmaker I believe you would need to crack the case open for the private keysYep pretty sure it’s engraved/etched on the side of the coin I have both coins but have not checked in years so you could be right.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: Bullion-n-BTC on December 04, 2022, 02:09:07 AM.0035 btcCurrent high bidQuote from: krogoth on December 03, 2022, 09:15:50 PMQuote from: stackinsats777 on December 03, 2022, 08:46:26 PMQuote from: krogoth on December 03, 2022, 08:36:38 PMQuote from: Cryptogreatdane on December 03, 2022, 08:27:10 PMNo holo on back? Where are private keys stored on these... besides with the coinmaker I believe you would need to crack the case open for the private keysYep pretty sure it’s engraved/etched on the side of the coin I have both coins but have not checked in years so you could be right. Correct... the private key is engraved/minted into the rim/side of the coin

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Quote from: minerjones on December 04, 2022, 03:16:27 AMQuote from: Bullion-n-BTC on December 04, 2022, 02:09:07 AM.0035 btcCurrent high bidQuote from: krogoth on December 03, 2022, 09:15:50 PMQuote from: stackinsats777 on December 03, 2022, 08:46:26 PMQuote from: krogoth on December 03, 2022, 08:36:38 PMQuote from: Cryptogreatdane on December 03, 2022, 08:27:10 PMNo holo on back? Where are private keys stored on these... besides with the coinmaker I believe you would need to crack the case open for the private keysYep pretty sure it’s engraved/etched on the side of the coin I have both coins but have not checked in years so you could be right. Correct... the private key is engraved/minted into the rim/side of the coin  Interesting.. seems like an odd place for a private key.. but i guess this was early on in the physical bitcoin world

comments.body: Quote from: Cryptogreatdane on December 04, 2022, 06:14:15 AMQuote from: minerjones on December 04, 2022, 03:16:27 AMQuote from: Bullion-n-BTC on December 04, 2022, 02:09:07 AM.0035 btcCurrent high bidQuote from: krogoth on December 03, 2022, 09:15:50 PMQuote from: stackinsats777 on December 03, 2022, 08:46:26 PMQuote from: krogoth on December 03, 2022, 08:36:38 PMQuote from: Cryptogreatdane on December 03, 2022, 08:27:10 PMNo holo on back? Correct... the private key is engraved/minted into the rim/side of the coin  Interesting.. seems like an odd place for a private key.. but i guess this was early on in the physical bitcoin worldAgreed, but was similar idea as a Kialara kinda, where you had to break open the sealed slab to get the coin out to reveal the key.Quote from: Bullion-n-BTC on December 04, 2022, 02:09:07 AM.0035 btcCurrent high bid

Just sad to see it turned out to be a scam.And:0.005
